TopicTitle: Is it possible to convert a Steam install to a KSP Store install

Articles.Content: My Steam appears to have stopped working. It will not open. Is there any way to convert that Steam install to a Store one?

I'm going to guess not, with a 99% likelihood of being correct in that guess.

Why not just reinstall Steam and take care of the problem?

Edited July 27, 2017 by regex
I'm guessing that I cant transfer my store install to steam?
go to the actual game folder and copy the EXE to the desktop. you dont need steam to launch the game if you do it this way.

I never play from my steam folder. Copy everything into another folder and play from there. Before I learned to do this I had to reinstall steam multiple times. Don't re-install it into the same steam folder- choose a different one. This should fix ur issue.

I haven't had any issues... 

Either reinstall Steam or copy the KSP folder (just the exe?) to another place.

Follow instructions from step 8 and 9.

It wont be "store install" but KSP is drf-free so you can unpin it from Steam.
Accounts cannot be transferred between purchase venues. Looks like something you'd need to contact Steam support about.
you don't have to run steam in order to run your games, just go into the steam folder and find the KSP folder. Run the game like you would any other program.

Unless a steam install doesn't include that file on ur PC the installer file should be in ur KSP folder somewhere. I used that to re-install KSP multiple times on different PCs or new systems.

 

For me it shows up as a Kerbal coming out of a cardboard box.

On 7/27/2017 at 11:34 PM, invision said:

go to the actual game folder and copy the EXE to the desktop. you dont need steam to launch the game if you do it this way.

Yes but the Steam copy is still stuk on 1.2.2 because reasons.

I've got it worked out though, thanks all!
